content: उपप्लवः {@--1@} Misfortune, evil, calamity, distress, adversity; अथ मदनवधूरुपप्लवांतं… परिपालयांबभूव <ls>Ku. 4. 46</ls>; जीवन्पुनः शश्वदुपप्लवेभ्यः प्रजाः पासि <ls>R. 2. 48</ls>; <ls>K. 32</ls>, <ls n="K.">54.</ls> {@--2@} ({%a%}) An unlucky accident, injury, trouble; कच्चिन्न वाय्वादिरुपप्लवो वः <ls>R. 5. 6</ls>; <ls>Me. 17.</ls> ({%b%}) An obstacle, impediment; <ls>Ki. 11. 20.</ls> {@--3@} Oppression, harassing, troubling; उपप्लवाय लोकानां धूमकेतुरिवोत्थितः <ls>Ku. 2. 32.</ls> {@--4@} Danger, fear; see उपप्लविन् below. {@--5@} Agitation, perturbation; इंद्रिय° <ls>K. 146.</ls> {@--6@} A portent or natural phenomenon foreboding evil. {@--7@} Particularly, an eclipse of the sun or moon; चंद्रमिवोपप्लवान्मुक्तं <ls>V. 1. 11.</ls> {@--8@} <ab>N.</ab> of Rāhu, the ascending node; केतूपप्लवभौममंदगतयः षष्ठे तृतीये शुभाः {@--9@} Anarchy. {@--10@} <ab>N.</ab> of Śiva. {@--11@} Doubt, scepticism (with Buddhists).
